name: A. A Compatible Pair
statement:
Little Tommy has lanterns and Big Banban has lanterns. Tommy’s lanterns
have brightness , and Banban’s have brightness respectively.Tommy
intends to hide one of his lanterns, then Banban picks one of Tommy’s
non-hidden lanterns and one of his own lanterns to form a pair. The
pair’s brightness will be the product of the brightness of two
lanterns.Tommy wants to make the product as small as possible, while
Banban tries to make it as large as possible.You are asked to find the
brightness of the chosen pair if both of them choose optimally.
